characters.name: Imaginative Reverie
characters.quote: walking clean over the edge of the log bridge into the brook while wrapped in imaginative reverie

characters.name: Peer Pressure
characters.quote: Daring was the fashionable amusement among the Avonlea small fry just then.

characters.name: Bravery And Challenge
characters.quote: I dare you to climb up there and walk the ridgepole of Mr. Barry's kitchen roof.

characters.name: Skepticism
characters.quote: I don't believe anybody could walk a ridgepole. _You_ couldn't, anyhow.

characters.name: Honor And Pride
characters.quote: I must do it. My honor is at stake.

characters.name: Risk And Consequences
characters.quote: walking ridgepoles was not a thing in which your imagination helped you out much.

characters.name: Injury And Vulnerability
characters.quote: My ankle,

characters.name: Guilt And Responsibility
characters.quote: But what would you have done, Marilla, if you had been dared to walk a ridgepole?

characters.name: Excitement For Learning
characters.quote: Oh, it's just glorious to think of it.

characters.name: Autumn Beauty
characters.quote: a glorious October, all red and gold, with mellow mornings when the valleys were filled with delicate mists

characters.name: Patriotism
characters.quote: A flag will cultivate a spirit of patriotism, Marilla.

characters.name: Ambition
characters.quote: I'll win that scholarship if hard work can do it.

characters.name: Appreciation
characters.quote: a little 'appreciation' sometimes does quite as much good as all the conscientious 'bringing up' in the world

characters.name: Awakening
characters.quote: That man is waking up after being asleep for over sixty years.

characters.name: Fashion And Vanity
characters.quote: Oh, how pretty it was--a lovely soft brown gloria with all the gloss of silk; a skirt with dainty frills and shirrings; a waist elaborately pintucked in the most fashionable way, with a little ruffle of filmy lace at the neck.

characters.name: Christmas Spirit
characters.quote: Merry Christmas, Marilla! Merry Christmas, Matthew! Isn't it a lovely Christmas?

characters.name: Celebration
characters.quote: Oh, hasn't it been a brilliant evening?

characters.name: Success
characters.quote: The concert came off in the evening and was a pronounced success.

characters.name: Nervousness
characters.quote: I was so nervous, Diana. When Mr. Allan called out my name I really cannot tell how I ever got up on that platform.

characters.name: Growing Up
characters.quote: Why, Anne, how you've grown!

characters.name: Social Rivalry
characters.quote: "Josie Pye had told Bessie Wright that Julia Bell's bow when she got up to recite made her think of a chicken jerking its head."

characters.name: Coming Of Age
characters.quote: "Just think, Diana, I'm thirteen years old today," remarked Anne in an awed voice.

characters.name: Jealousy
characters.quote: "All her affection for Geraldine turned to bitter hate."

characters.name: Moral Lessons
characters.quote: "I insist upon that. All the good people are rewarded and all the bad ones are suitably punished."

characters.name: Spring Awakening
characters.quote: "the thrill of delight that spring never fails to bring"

characters.name: Personal Reflection
characters.quote: "she probably imagined that she was thinking about the Aids and their missionary box"

characters.name: Understanding
characters.quote: "Perhaps you're judging her too hasty, Marilla. Don't call her untrustworthy until you're sure she has disobeyed you."

characters.name: Despair
characters.quote: "I'm in the depths of despair and I don't care who gets head in class or writes the best composition or sings in the Sunday-school choir any more."

characters.name: Consequences Of Actions
characters.quote: "I dyed it!"

characters.name: Deception And Trust
characters.quote: "I believed every word he said implicitly."

characters.name: Vanity Consequences
characters.quote: "I repented of being wicked, I can tell you."

characters.name: Desire For Change
characters.quote: "I thought it was worth while to be a little wicked to get rid of red hair."

characters.name: Shame And Regret
characters.quote: "Oh, Marilla, what shall I do?"

characters.name: Tragic Transformation
characters.quote: "It seems such a tragic thing."

characters.name: Desire For Goodness
characters.quote: "I do really want to be good, Marilla, like you and Mrs. Allan and Miss Stacy"

characters.name: Danger
characters.quote: "The flat began to leak. In a very few moments it was necessary for Elaine to scramble to her feet..."

characters.name: Fear And Survival
characters.quote: "I was horribly frightened"

characters.name: Faith And Action
characters.quote: "I prayed, Mrs. Allan, most earnestly, but I didn't shut my eyes to pray"

characters.name: Reality Vs. Romance
characters.quote: "It was a very unromantic position, but I didn't think about that at the time."

characters.name: Rescue And Friendship
characters.quote: "Gilbert Blythe came rowing under the bridge in Harmon Andrews's dory!"

characters.name: Pride And Resentment
characters.quote: No,

characters.name: Evening Calm
characters.quote: the spaces under the firs were filled with a clear violet dusk like airy wine.

characters.name: Musical Nature
characters.quote: there is no sweeter music on earth than that which the wind makes in the fir trees at evening.

characters.name: Joy Of Life
characters.quote: Isn't this evening just like a purple dream, Diana? It makes me so glad to be alive.

characters.name: Desire For Freedom
characters.quote: I was bitterly disappointed, Diana. I felt so heartbroken that I wouldn't say my prayers when I went to bed.

characters.name: Social Pressure
characters.quote: It's so aggravating to hear the other girls talking about their trips.

characters.name: Adventure
characters.quote: But Anne counted it all joy, and was up before sunrise on Tuesday morning.

characters.name: Welcoming And Hospitality
characters.quote: "So you've come to see me at last, you Anne-girl," she said.

characters.name: Contrast Of Life
characters.quote: I came to the conclusion, Marilla, that I wasn't born for city life and that I was glad of it.

characters.name: Unspoken Love
characters.quote: Her love made her afraid of being unduly indulgent, indeed.

characters.name: Character Development
characters.quote: she said if the foundation was shaky we could never build anything really worth while on it.

characters.name: Deceit And Guilt
characters.quote: I had never realized until that moment, Marilla, that what I was doing was deceitful.

characters.name: Literature And Morality
characters.quote: Miss Stacy said it was a very silly, unwholesome book, and she asked me not to read any more of it or any like it.

characters.name: Youth And Restrictions
characters.quote: It's such a solemn thing to be almost fourteen, Marilla.

characters.name: Self-improvement
characters.quote: I warn you not to expect much in geometry, but I think I can hold my own in anything else if I work hard.

characters.name: Joyful Growth
characters.quote: For Anne the days slipped by like golden beads on the necklace of the year.

characters.name: Seasonal Change
characters.quote: almost before Anne realized it, spring had come again to Green Gables and all the world was abloom once more.

characters.name: Indifference To Studies
characters.quote: Latin verbs and French exercises had somehow lost the tang and zest they had possessed in the crisp winter months.

characters.name: Celebration Of Achievements
characters.quote: Miss Stacy told them on the last evening, "and you deserve a good, jolly vacation."

characters.name: Teacher's Commitment
characters.quote: "Yes, I think I will," said Miss Stacy.

characters.name: Student Attachment
characters.quote: "I thought of taking another school, but I have decided to come back to Avonlea. To tell the truth, I've grown so interested in my pupils here that I found I couldn't leave them. So I'll stay and see you through."

characters.name: Freedom And Joy
characters.quote: "ANNE had her 'good' summer and enjoyed it wholeheartedly."

characters.name: Health And Well-being
characters.quote: "Keep that redheaded girl of yours in the open air all summer and don't let her read books until she gets more spring into her step."

characters.name: Academic Pressure
characters.quote: "Suppose they did not pass! That thought was doomed to haunt Anne through the waking hours of that winter, Sunday afternoons inclusive, to the almost entire exclusion of moral and theological problems."

characters.name: Guidance And Mentorship
characters.quote: "Much of all this was due to Miss Stacy's tactful, careful, broadminded guidance."

characters.name: Self-doubt
characters.quote: "I got dreadfully mixed up in the dates."

characters.name: Perseverance
characters.quote: "I think I did fairly well today."

characters.name: Achievement
characters.quote: "Yes, she had passed--there was her name at the very top of a list of two hundred! That moment was worth living for."

characters.name: Gratitude
characters.quote: "...murmured a prayer of gratitude and aspiration that came straight from her heart."

characters.name: Enjoyment
characters.quote: "It was a night for enjoyment."

characters.name: Longing For Home
characters.quote: "Oh, if she were only back at Green Gables!"

characters.name: Artistic Aspiration
characters.quote: "Anne, forgetting all about herself and her troubles for the time, listened with rapt and shining eyes; but when the recitation ended she suddenly put her hands over her face."

characters.name: Stage Fright
characters.quote: "Anne was the victim of an overwhelming attack of stage fright."

characters.name: Courage And Determination
characters.quote: "She drew a long breath and flung her head up proudly, courage and determination tingling over her like an electric shock."

characters.name: Public Perception
characters.quote: "These people, she thought, would be merciless critics."

characters.name: Wealth And Materialism
characters.quote: "Wouldn't you just love to be rich, girls?"

characters.name: Kindness And Generosity
characters.quote: "Anne, here's something for a nice light dress for you."

characters.name: Homesickness
characters.quote: "she thought of her own white room at Green Gables, where she would have the pleasant consciousness of a great green still outdoors"

characters.name: Dreams And Aspirations
characters.quote: "looked out unheedingly across city roof and spire to that glorious dome of sunset sky and wove her dreams of a possible future from the golden tissue of youth's own optimism."

characters.name: Victory And Achievement
characters.quote: "Three cheers for Miss Shirley, winner of the Avery!"

characters.name: Financial Worry
characters.quote: All we have saved is in that bank--every penny.

characters.name: Family Bonds
characters.quote: I'd rather have you than a dozen boys, Anne.

characters.name: Fear And Concern
characters.quote: It was Marilla who spoke, alarm in every jerky word.

characters.name: Urgency And Action
characters.quote: They were both too late; before they could reach him Matthew had fallen across the threshold.

characters.name: Fear Of Loss
characters.quote: Panic and sorrow are felt as the character confronts the possibility of losing someone dear.

characters.name: Desperation
characters.quote: Anne, run for Martin--quick, quick! He's at the barn.

characters.name: Death's Impact
characters.quote: the white majesty of death had fallen on him and set him apart as one crowned.

characters.name: Sudden Shock
characters.quote: The secret of the shock was discovered to be in the paper Matthew had held.

characters.name: Isolation In Grief
characters.quote: I want to be alone. I'm not afraid.

characters.name: Emotional Exhaustion
characters.quote: ...until she fell asleep, worn out with the day's pain and excitement.

characters.name: Comfort And Support
characters.quote: We've got each other, Anne.

characters.name: Routine And Normalcy
characters.quote: affairs slipped into their old groove and work was done and duties fulfilled with regularity as before

characters.name: Disloyalty To The Deceased
characters.quote: It seems like disloyalty to Matthew, somehow, to find pleasure in these things now that he has gone.

characters.name: Connection To Nature
characters.quote: I hope he has roses like them in heaven.

characters.name: Loss Of Home
characters.quote: Oh, Anne, I wish I didn't have to. But you can see for yourself. I can't stay here alone.

characters.name: Self-sacrifice
characters.quote: I'm not going to take the scholarship. I decided so the night after you came home from town.

characters.name: Hope And Planning
characters.quote: Oh, I have it all planned out, Marilla.

characters.name: Community Judgment
characters.quote: Most of the good folks, not knowing about Marilla's eyes, thought she was foolish.
